intro: Saxicolella deniseae, commonly known as the Denise's saxifrage, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, alpine environments. Its leaves are usually succulent, allowing it to retain moisture in arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Saxicolella deniseae is considered a vulnerable species.
